newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Bre-X, Indonesian partner in Busang talks.
newsitem.headline: Bre-X, Indonesian partner in Busang talks.

text.p: An Indonesian partner of Canadian mining company Bre-X Minerals Ltd. said Monday he had put off a $1.9 billion lawsuit against Bre-X because it was willing to discuss the ownership dispute over the Busang gold find.
Businessman Jusuf Merukh, who claims to own 40 percent of the spectacular find in East Kalimantan, said Bre-X had been in touch with his lawyers in opening negotiations over their dispute.
He had given Bre-X, which has estimated Busang contains at least 47 million ounces of gold, until Wednesday to start serious negotiations.
"I am delaying the legal action because Bre-X has been in touch with my lawyers," he told Reuters.

Merukh, who declined to give further details, had been locked in an ownership dispute with Bre-X, which led to the Indonesian government delaying issuing a contract of work Bre-X until their dispute was resolved.
The government has since advised Bre-X to team up with Barrick Gold Corp. to develop Busang, with Bre-X taking a 25 percent stake and Barrick 75 percent.
It has given both parties until Wednesday to strike a deal, and also said it wanted a 10 percent stake, to be allocated by Bre-X and Barrick.
Bre-X has a partnership deal with PT Panutan Duta of the Panutan Group, run by President Suharto's eldest son, Sigit Harjojudanto.
Panutan would receive $40 million over 40 months plus a 10 percent stake in Busang's richest areas under the deal.
Barrick has teamed up with a construction company in the Citra Group of Suharto's eldest daughter, Siti Hardianti Rukmana.
